body:
Happy to support it, but better to use the [`Schema(...)`](https://pydantic-docs.helpmanual.io/#schema-creation) class than misusing types.

@tiangolo you did all the JSON schema work, any thoughts?

Sounds good!

I can imagine something like:

```Python
class Foo(BaseModel):
    bar: str = Schema("baz", const=True)

```

issue.title: Implement const keyword in Schema.

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
Tagging @tiangolo, since you were involved in the discussion in #434 .

I'm not sure how elegant this implementation is, especially with respect to how I've done validation, but I figure it's a starting point at the very least.

## Change Summary

Adds support for the [JSON Schema `const` keyword](https://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html#rfc.section.6.1.3).

## Related issue number

#434 

## Checklist

* [x] Unit tests for the changes exist
* [x] Tests pass on CI and coverage remains at 100%
* [x] Documentation reflects the changes where applicable
* [x] `HISTORY.rst` has been updated
  * if this is the first change since a release, please add a new section
  * include the issue number or this pull request number `#<number>`
  * include your github username `@<whomever>`

body: BTW, I found the time to have a stab at this yesterday. I'm still not particularly familiar with the code base as a whole, so I might have gone about it in completely the wrong way, but it seems to work at the very least.

issue.title: Update Pydantic to v0.25

repository.name: fastapi
repository.description: FastAPI framework, high performance, easy to learn, fast to code, ready for production

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Pydantic structural subtyping can't differentiate between two semantically different but structurally identical types. Hence, in the current Pydantic v0.25 release the `const` keyword was introduced to help with that, [Pydantic issue link](https://github.com/samuelcolvin/pydantic/issues/434). Unfortunately, at the moment FastAPI works with versions less than 0.23, `fastapi (0.20.0) depends on pydantic (>=0.17,<=0.23.0)`  

**Describe the solution you'd like**
I would like to update to pydantic v0.25

body:
If I interpret right `foo: str = Field('bar', const=True)` results in bar being an optional property since it has a default. How could I make it required?

I have structurally identical types, and want a required name variable that is constant for each type.

foo: str = Field(..., const=True)

This is in the docs, please read them first.

That doesn't set the constant value to 'bar' as I had in my example, unless I misunderstand you.
`foo: typing.Literal['bar']` seems to be what I was looking for.
